intro:

BTW, I use Arch.

post.body: Hello ZeroMe!
Does anybody here have this file? "i2pbote.su3" The website where I could get it is currently down
This is so dead, tell more people about ZeroNet.
I just spent half an hour manualy downloading outdated packages, to find out that software that needed it just won't work.
Is there a ban system on the ZeroNet? I would imagine there isn't.
Can you decipher it? Email me your solutions.
How was your day?

@Quantumworld mentioned that backup script would be good, so I created a simple bash script, just make it run at boot and you're golden Edit: Thanks to @SSDifnskdjfnsdjk this script should automatically delete old backups and is displayed correctly Edit 2: Small change \#!/bin/bash \# Change these variables file=/path/to/users.json backups=/where/to/backup/ \# Do not change anything here log=$backups"log.txt" DATE=\`date +%Y-%m-%d\` mkdir -p $backups if [ -e $log ] then rm $log fi touch $log echo "Starting backup script" >> $log echo "users.json : " $file >> $log echo "Date of start : "$DATE >> $log while true do cp $file $backups"users.json."$DATE echo "Created backup users.json."$DATE >> $log find $backups -type f -name \*"users.json"\* -mtime +180 -delete sleep 1d done
Do those spammers know that you can mute then by hitting literally 3 buttons?

My baby is complete. (Unless I think of something to add.) It's written in C#.

It encrypts your words with my encryption process. It's a simple process, but quite difficult to crack (I hope). (Do you see the meme?) You can get it [here](http://mojserver2.ddns.net/C-Sharp), I'll make decrytor if I won't be lazy.

If you have any questions or security concerns, just mail me, I'll be happy to answer them.

I created Cipher decoder and I added an easter egg to Cipher maker, link to **source code**s of both programs, if you find the link, please, don't share it or **source code**s. Both programs can be downloaded [here](http://mojserver2.ddns.net/C-Sharp).

If you have any questions or security concerns, just mail me, I'll be happy to answer them.

I'm a "sinner", yet forgive me nothing. 
I'm a "heathen", but forever free!﻿
What's your favourite distro?
What happened on the ZeroNet in the ~ 3 weeks I wasn't here?
What's your favourite DE and why?
There are 10 kinds of people in the world, those who understand binary and those who don't.
Something's broken
Branné cvičenie (Google translates it as military training  but it's more like civil protection), do you have it in your country? In Slovakia, it's organised twice in a school year. It's quite fun.
Solve for coordinates of C. How would you solve it? [My solution (clearnet)](http://mojserver2.ddns.net/.hidden/EPSON003-1~2.jpg)
Do you use 0.6.5 or 0.7.0 client?
What music genre is your favourite?

Do you think people would be more interested in computers if they knew that computers are made of silicon (fake tits) and dope ([Urban Dictionary](https://www.urbandictionary.com/define.php?term=Dope), [silicon doping](https://www.halbleiter.org/index.php/fundamentals/doping/?bereich=fundamentals&thema=doping&sprache=en))?
Do you play [NationStates](https://www.nationstates.net)?
I've just bought "The art of war" by Sun Tzu, it's an interesting book.

I'm so mad right now! My laptop won't boot my HDD with Manjaro, not even a live USB with Manjaro and I have no idea why, I'll see if it can boot Pop!_OS live USB.

Edit: For some reason Pop!_OS live USB boots, I'll get my stuff from the HDD and install that OS. If you know any reason why this works and that does not, please, tell me.

***I'M BACK!!!***
What happened in the last month?
Guess what distro I use.
This is bad kill/death ratio.
Is anybody up for a game of Stellaris?
I'm back everyone! You missed me, didn't you?
I decided to learn Vim, any tips?

comment.body: Interesting, I'm happy to see I'm not the only one who sees privacy as important thing.
I'm not going to give you bitcoin, but I can give you a little bit of dogecoin.
@Deliriumgoddesss: File format
@Deliriumgoddesss: It's email plugin for I2P
@Deliriumgoddesss: It's takes a few until you can connect to websites, about 10 minutes
@Deliriumgoddess: If the I2P says "Network: Firewalled", it's ok
@Deliriumgoddesss: How long has been I2P running?
@Deliriumgoddesss: Check your mail
@Anonyme: I'll send you 1 one doge, what's your address?
Bitcoin is dropping in value, so I wouldn't call it "currency of the future" and "financial monsters" like cryptocurrencies, because it's something that is tradeable and easy to store.
@Againandagain: Give it a few years/months
@Deliriumgoddesss: China is authoritarian country, so I'm not surprised, but in Russia it's allowed, but slightly regulated (https://www.quora.com/Did-Russia-ban-Bitcoin?share=1)

@Deliriumgoddesss: I found mentions of prison for trading with cryptocurencies, but I didn't find anything that says that the law passed. But I found this "Russia to launch the CryptoRuble", why would they do it if you couldn't trade with cryptocurencies?

@Deliriumgoddesss: "Vladimir Putin made a stir in October of 2017 when he announced Russia would be issuing its own state-sponsored cryptocurrency." "It would be issued by the government and not mined." Doesn't look very nongovernment to me.

@Deliriumgoddesss: I found that i2pbote plugin, but older version, that needed outdated package, that package also had some dependencies and they had dependencies too, so you have like 20 packages you need and none of them are in apt repositories, 'cause they were replaced with newer versions and the new versions aren't compatible, so I had to manualy look for and download every single thing.
@Realjohndoe: Thank you for reminding me about the existence of Termux, now I use that to use ZeroNet on my phone, instead of official app. :-)
@Deliriumgoddesss: Yeah, nowadays corruption is everywhere. :'-(

@Realjohndoe: The app worked terribly for me, I couldn't even press the three line to get to options, I could connect to the network, but not as me. It may be because my phone is old and the ROM I use is the first ever Android 8 for the phone.
@Realjohndoe: I like that there's no censorship, it's definitely better to follow your own sense of morality compared to being forced to be "politically correct".
@Styromaniac: Imagine upvote from me
I would prefer "Barbarism" over Socialism.
@SSDifnskdjfnsdjk: Thank you
@Quantumworld: There's a while true loop without any exit condition, so it should save daily, we'll see tomorrow.
@SSDifnskdjfnsdjk: I just write it into a file and then execute the file using "/etc/rc.local", but I'll take a look at it
@Quantumworld: What?
@SSDifnskdjfnsdjk: Do you have any estimation how much space all the zites would require? I've got just 10 GB of storage left.
@piloth@zeroid.bit: Should work now
@Pexo: @leftside: I can answer any of your questions using mail, not publicly for reason given in mail I just sent you
@leftside: Check my previous reply. Don't worry, it is not malicious software.
@leftside: The source code is an Easter egg, but if you the source code, send me mail and just ask for it

@leftside: I don't want to share source codes of these two projects publicly, but through an Easter egg, but if you want to see it without finding the Easter egg, or you are afraid that it's malicious software, send me an email using Mail.ZeroNetwork.bit and ask for it.

What's the value of illegalList?
Edit:
Changes I made to make it work:

var illegalList: Set = ["freedom", "weapon"]
var illegalList1 = illegalList

@Deliriumgoddesss: First one isn't true, becuase illegalList doesn't contain "freedom" (because isSuperset(of:) method tests whether all elements of a set are contained in another set or sequence). If you add "freedom", second will be also true, because illegalList is illegalList3 + some more things ( because isStrictSuperset(of:) method tests whether a set is a subset or superset of, but not equal to, another set). If you want second to be false, add '!' before 'illegalList1...' or use 'illegalList1 == illegalList3'. Some [documentation I used](https://developer.apple.com/documentation/swift/set)
@Deliriumgoddesss: var illegalList1 = illegalList Without the square brackets

@Deliriumgoddesss: Here's the code modified:
var illegalList: Set = ["children porno","drugs","weapon","freedom"]
var illegalList1 = illegalList
var illegalList2: Set = ["childern porn", "drugs", "rape", "racism"]
var illegalList3: Set = ["freedom", "weapon"]
print("4 question: Is Russia illegal List contains all of China illegal List? Answer:", (illegalList1.isSuperset(of: illegalList3))) //suppose to be true
print("5 question: Is Russia illegal List same as China illegal List? Answer:", (illegalList == illegalList3)) //suppose to be false
print("6 question: Is in Russia illegal List absent China illegal List? Answer:", (illegalList1.isDisjoint(with: illegalList3))) //suppose to be false
@Deliriumgoddesss: Without the 'Set'

@Quantumworld: Yes, but it's more effective than just shouting.
@Quantumworld: I don't care about your feelings in a discussion.
That's sad :(
@Quantumworld: I'm not Russian, I'm not a woman and didn't say that Putin is good.
@Quantumworld: You can think whatever you want about me, but let me correct your assumption, I live in a flat, not house.
@Quantumworld: I'm not a flat earther just because I live in a flat, but, as I said before, you can think whatever you want about me.
@Quantumworld: That's interesting, but I sure don't care. Let's get back to whether or not discussion is more effective than shouting.
@Quantumworld: Shouting indicates poorly handled communication or that you are running out of points to defend your claims.

@Quantumworld: Nah mate, the moment you said "This is so offensive" I knew you weren't serious, nobody offended would actually say that, they would just block me, I just wanted to see if I can piss you off and/or get an interesting reaction.
Hi!
Utopia, from Greek ou "not" + topos "place". Are you talking about that utopia?
Not really
I'm an atheist and I don't support any religion.
I play Kerbal Space Program, Stellaris, Hearts of iron 4 and Mount & Blade: Warband
@Deliriumgoddess6: Yes, Greek alphabet -> Hlaholika (I don't know how's it called in English) -> Cyrilika (I don't know how's it called in English) -> Azbuka. I think that's how it evolved

@Deliriumgoddess6: Thank you for correcting me about the alphabet.
Christianisation sure was a bloody process.

@Mg0: Fat32. Last time I used the USB, it was on a Linux system, maybe I'll see something on it, but I doubt it.

@Kid Courageous: It's not video, that's PayDay 2 mods, I downloaded the game to a different computer so I used the USB to move the mods.

@Mg0: Windows can use only the first partition on a USB stick, right? (That's a bug if I'm not mistaken) I had two partitions on the USB and I could use them both, so maybe Windows just shat itsefl and corupted the USB.
Agree, I do.

@leftside: I'm from Slovakia.
It's 'tg', we use that instead of 'tan', but it's the same function.

@leftside: tan^-1 is the inverse function of tan, so if you use the result of tan as input for tan^-1, you will get tan's original input [(see image)](http://mojserver2.ddns.net/.hidden/Screenshot_20190527-160347.jpeg).
I also thought math was THE universal language.
@leftside: That's just written alphabet [(see image, letters aren't in alphabetical order)](http://mojserver2.ddns.net/.hidden/thumb.jpeg). But my handwriting is terrible, I admit it.

@leftside: It's not Cyrillic, I don't know Cyrillic, it's Latin alphabet extended with our letter (š - read as sh, č - read as ch etc.), but in its handwritten version.
Yes, we have English as second language.

@leftside: Slovakia, Slovenia is a different country (funny thing is, even postal services sometimes get it wrong, so don't feel bad)
Yeah, they are from Slovak alphabet [(example sentence, without our special symbols)](http://mojserver2.ddns.net/.hidden/EPSON004~2.jpg)

@leftside: Probably yes, but I can't tell you for sure since I haven't graduated highschool yet, I'll be able to answer this question in about 3 years. Sadly, our highschools don't teach complex numbers, I know that for sure.

@leftside: I listen to music (power metal to be more specific), I code in my free time when I fell like it plus my school teaches Python (that's why I created this problem, to create rectangles at an angle [(see code)](http://mojserver2.ddns.net/Python/Sqr&Rec.py)) and I can't draw, my drawing skills are somewhere between a toddler and a talented first grader at elementary school (here it's age 6 - 7)
@leftside: Do you not use powers of negative numbers?
Yeah, ZeroNet is great
@leftside: When I tested the code it worked, I'll try it again in about 3 hours (both versions).

@leftside: I tried them and now I think I know why my code didn't work. It was intended to be used in the Python IDLE IDE. IDLE shows the result of a code even after the execution is over. Thank you for correcting that.
